intro: Dalechampia trifoliata var. trifoliata, commonly known as the three-leaved dalechampia, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in swamps and along stream banks. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
